intro: Ocimum americanum, commonly known as American basil, is a herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in clusters. Its leaves are oval-shaped, glossy, and emit a strong, sweet scent when crushed. Ocimum americanum is often used in culinary applications and traditional medicine due to its aromatic properties.
